{"text": "Â§6L.EotR
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0It was a dank and humid day when the first traveller passed.
 
It was the first foreigner that Kalo had ever met.

People held their tongues as the traveller passed."}

{"text": "Â§6L.EotR
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§7

 *Crunch*

              *Crunch*




 *Crunch*"}

{"text": "Â§6L.EotR
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0Rang out the soft beats of the travellers footsteps as he passed on the sun bathed gravel.

Â§7 *crunch*

          *crunch*

  *crr-unch*"}

{"text": "Â§6L.EotR
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0The traveller spoke out in a tongue which the young Kalo was unfamilliar.

Definitely not one of the languages they taught at the academy though."}

{"text": "Â§6L.EotR
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§7*crunch*

          *crunch*


  *crr-unch*
              *crunch*
  *crunch* 
            *crunch*
      *crunch*
        *crunch*"}

{"text": "Â§6L.EotR
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0The wanderer came to a halt at the young Kalo's door.
 
The traveller smelling heavily of herbs and spices, covered in a shroud of pungent aromas rivaling those of Kalo's younger sister, Niyori."}

{"text": "Â§6L.EotR
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0As the traveller leaned in he whispered something to Kalo and handed him two small Â§6rocksÂ§0Â§0...

The traveller eagerly looking to Kalo for a response.

"}

{"text": "Â§6L.EotR
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -

Â§0Kalo's father layed in the door opening, almost wrestling the wanderer that, just moments prior had stood before the young Kalo.


"}

{"text": "Â§6L.EotR
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0Kalo's father rose from the gravel and dirt dusting his robes and garments.
 
The traveller, after letting out what seemed to be a hearty laugh followed suit. Rising slowly from the ground in a cloud of dust."}

{"text": "Â§6L.EotR
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0Kalo's father looked at the man briefl before recipricating the gesture cracking a smile and looking at Kalo.

Kalo knew what to do fetching the teaset and tableware setting the table for the two men."}

{"text": "Â§6L.EotR
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0The men spoke slowly but seemingly fondly in their tongue.

Occationally one of the men would lift a cup of tea to their lips only to be interrupted by the other."}

{"text": "Â§6L.EotR
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0The traveller would eventually drink the cup, stand up, give a slight bow and leave.

As the sun set across the land a lone travellers steps could be heard.

As he walked towards the light."}

{"text": "Â§9MuMC
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0A cool breeze swept across the fields as the women finished binding the bundles of hay. Harvest season was always like this.


A blessing from Ryula some would claim. "}

{"text": "\u00c2\u00a79MuMC\n\u00c2\u00a75 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -\n\u00c2\u00a70Others would claim that it was a curse. The hot baking sun making the kitchens and ovens hotter than needed. Often making it hard to breathe or be in the room for alot more than a few seconds at a time."}

{"text": "\u00c2\u00a79MuMC\n\u00c2\u00a75 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -\n\u00c2\u00a70As the sun set, country and housing cooling for the day and allowing for the day came to a close a lone wanderer would become visible on the horizon."}

{"text": "Â§9MuMC
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0Their scabbard, though empty appearing to be a much bigger theat than the heat of the fields or of the bakers furnace.

The song of birds halted- "}

{"text": "Â§9MuMC
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0occationally resuming just to be cut short by the stranger taking another step. The soft grass making the rustling of their equipment land with a soft thud.

As night crept in the stranger found a rock to sit against."}

{"text": "Â§9MuMC
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0looking over a field they'd occationally see a small bunny rabbit running inbetween the hay bundles and the remaining stock.

As the clouds parted in the night and allowed for the shimmer of the moon"}

{"text": "Â§9MuMC
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0to pass through the stranger let out a deep sigh.

They knew their time had come and that they couldn't escape it any longer.

The stranger doffing their equipment shed a tear."}

{"text": "Â§9MuMC
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0As the sun rose heating the huts and ovens of the village one of the men noticed some armor by a rock.

A scabbard inscribed with initials.
A piece of iron mail with a leather cutout where the heart is."}

{"text": "Â§9MuMC
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0and buried in the armor a piece of paper that reads;

  Â§7"I could not care 
    for her....
     I hope you can
      Stranger...     "
"}

{"text": "Â§1DfaBO
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0There was a shadow that moved gracefully in the water just beneath the surface.

Although it did not display color nor did it sparkle. But it swam with content."}

{"text": "Â§1DfaBO
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0It did not have a need to stand out in order to find a pretense for it to simply exist. Maybe thats the simple reason why it just persists.

The fish grew larger as a man stepped to the surface..."}

{"text": "Â§1DfaBO
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0yet the fish was neither hungry nor satsfied. Yet it displayed its grey beauty allowing for all to see. Although many just saw what they wanted to believe.
One claimed to have seen a rainbow another a sparkle."}

{"text": "Â§1DfaBO
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0yet the fish sounded out as it heard another crackle and a man stepped into the water.


Yet the fish was still not hungry or satisfied."}

{"text": "Â§1DfaBO
Â§5 -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -
Â§0A man jumped in the water into the jaws of the fish.


Though the fish felt sorrow. "}
